intro: Selnorition obovalis, commonly known as the broad-leafed sunbinder, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its broad, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, waxy coating to reduce water loss. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom during the cooler months. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it well adapted to its harsh environment. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists studying xerophytic adaptations.
